abstract_summ: We suggest that highly suspected pediatric COVID-19 cases with negative nucleic acid tests on nasopharyngeal swabs should be further checked by performing a nucleic acid test on stool samples and testing serum for antibodies against SARS-CoV-2.Clusters of patients with novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) have been successively reported globally.Here we present two pediatric COVID-19 cases, both of whom exhibited negative SARS-CoV-2 nucleic acid tests upon nasopharyngeal swab and were initially diagnosed with influenza A infection.CONCLUSIONS: Pediatric patients with COVID-19 are mostly owing to family cluster or with a close contact history.These findings serve as a practical reference for the clinical diagnosis and medical treatment of children with COVID-19.Abstract Objective This is a brief report of 4 paediatric cases of COVID-19 infection in Malaysia Background COVID-19, a coronavirus, first detected in Wuhan, China has now spread rapidly to over 60 countries and territories around the world, infecting more than 85000 individuals.BACKGROUND: Although people of all ages are susceptible to the novel coronavirus infection, which is presently named “Coronavirus Disease 2019” (COVID-19), there has been relatively few cases reported among children.
title_summ: No evidence of viral polymorphisms associated with Paediatric Inflammatory Multisystem Syndrome Temporally Associated With SARS-CoV-2 (PIMS-TS).[Diagnosis and treatment recommendation for pediatric COVID-19 (the second edition)].Clinical features of pediatric patients with COVID-19: a report of two family cluster casesAre They Just Two Children COVID-19 Cases Confused With Flu?COVID-19 in a patient with long-term use of glucocorticoids: A study of a familial clusterFirst Case of an Infant with COVID-19 in the Middle EastCOVID-19: Four Paediatric Cases in MalaysiaSerology confirms SARS-CoV-2 infection in PCR-negative children presenting with Paediatric Inflammatory Multi-System SyndromeA child with household transmitted COVID-19A 3-month-old child with COVID-19: A case report
title_abstract_phrases: We suggest that highly suspected pediatric COVID-19 cases with negative nucleic acid tests on nasopharyngeal swabs should be further checked by performing a nucleic acid test on stool samples and testing serum for antibodies against SARS-CoV-2.COVID-19 in a patient with long-term use of glucocorticoids: A study of a familial clusterClusters of patients with novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) have been successively reported globally.Here we present two pediatric COVID-19 cases, both of whom exhibited negative SARS-CoV-2 nucleic acid tests upon nasopharyngeal swab and were initially diagnosed with influenza A infection.CONCLUSIONS: Pediatric patients with COVID-19 are mostly owing to family cluster or with a close contact history.Serology confirms SARS-CoV-2 infection in PCR-negative children presenting with Paediatric Inflammatory Multi-System SyndromeBACKGROUND: During the COVID-19 outbreak, reports have surfaced of children who present with features of a multisystem inflammatory syndrome with overlapping features of Kawasaki disease and toxic shock syndrome - Paediatric Inflammatory Multisystem Syndrome- temporally associated with SARS-CoV-2 pandemic (PIMS-TS).A child with household transmitted COVID-19BACKGROUND: Although people of all ages are susceptible to the novel coronavirus infection, which is presently named “Coronavirus Disease 2019” (COVID-19), there has been relatively few cases reported among children.
